title.value: Structured Learning in Time-dependent Cox Models
title.justification: The title is evident in the provided paper excerpt.
title.quote: Structured Learning in Time-dependent Cox Models

extractions.description: This paper proposes a flexible framework for variable selection in time-dependent Cox models. It introduces the ‘sox’ package, which implements a network flow algorithm to efficiently solve models with complex covariate structures. The methodology is demonstrated through simulations and a case study on predictors of time to all-cause death in atrial fibrillation patients.

type.justification: The paper demonstrates the practical application of their proposed method through examples, simulations, and a real-world case study.
type.quote: Through examples, including a case study on identifying predictors of time to all-cause death in atrial fibrillation patients, we demonstrate the practical application of our method with specific selection rules.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on using Cox models, which are commonly used in survival analysis, to study time-dependent variables and their effect on survival outcomes.
name.quote: Cox models with time-dependent coefficients and covariates are widely used in survival analysis.

name.justification: The paper discusses handling high-dimensional data in the context of time-dependent Cox models.
name.quote: In high-dimensional settings, sparse regularization techniques are employed for variable selection.

name.justification: The paper incorporates sparse regularization techniques for variable selection in time-dependent Cox models.
name.quote: We propose a flexible framework for variable selection in time-dependent Cox models, accommodating complex selection rules.

name.justification: The paper develops and implements a network flow algorithm for structured variable selection.
name.quote: We develop the sox package, implementing a network flow algorithm for efficiently solving models with complex covariate structures.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses the use of Cox models for time-dependent data.
name.quote: The Cox model 1 is a well-established statistical model widely used for survival data analysis.

is_contributed.justification: The Cox model is not contributed by the paper; it is an existing statistical model used in the study.
is_contributed.quote: The Cox model 1 is a well-established statistical model widely used for survival data analysis.

is_executed.justification: The paper involves practical experiments and simulations utilizing the Cox model.
is_executed.quote: We conduct several simulation studies. We evaluate our method in both low- and high-dimensional settings.

is_compared.justification: The Cox model is compared with other methods like LASSO in the study.
is_compared.quote: The performance of the two methods was evaluated using several measures, as presented in Table S2. For each simulated dataset, these measures were calculated individually and then averaged to obtain the overall performance statistics.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Cox model is an established model in the literature and does not have a single referenced paper title.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The Cox model 1 is a well-established statistical model widely used for survival data analysis.

name.justification: The paper mentions extracting data from the Régie de l’Assurance Maladie du Québec (RAMQ) database for the case study on atrial fibrillation patients.
name.quote: The data used in this study were obtained from a larger dataset and represent 36,381 patients...
